facts.1: National Doctors' Day is celebrated on March 30th to honor the contributions of doctors and physicians.
facts.2: The first Doctors' Day was observed in 1933 in Winder, Georgia, and involved sending greeting cards to doctors and placing flowers on the graves of deceased physicians.
facts.3: The red carnation is the symbolic flower of National Doctors' Day, representing the qualities of sacrifice, courage, and love.

Day 2.title: Take a Walk in the Park Day

facts.1: Take a Walk in the Park Day encourages people to enjoy the beauty of nature and the health benefits of walking.
facts.2: Walking in the park can reduce stress, improve mood, and provide a great opportunity for physical exercise.
facts.3: Many parks offer scenic walking trails, playgrounds, and picnic areas, making them ideal places for family outings and relaxation.

facts.1: National Pencil Day celebrates the invention and history of the pencil, a fundamental tool for writing and drawing.
facts.2: The modern pencil was invented in 1795 by Nicholas-Jacques Conte, a French artist and army officer.
facts.3: Pencils are made from a mixture of graphite and clay, encased in wood, and are available in various grades of hardness for different uses.
